frontmatter.title: Omar Wasow (Pomona College, Black Planet)
frontmatter.subtitle: Presented by the Initiative for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst
frontmatter.author: Initiative for Digital Public Infrastructure
frontmatter.excerpt: Well before Facebook achieved social media dominance, Black Planet was the online home to millions of Black Americans. The siteâ€™s founder Omar Wasow joins us to talk about why it was so important to create an online space for Black people, and what a next generation of the Internet might look like for such communities.
